title: Minimum Time
problem_statement:
3. Minimum Time

The students of HackerSchool are working on a science project that demonstrates the magnetic property. Given n plates and their positions (X[i], Y[i]), find the minimum amount of time to collect every plate.

The plates have a magnetic power of d. When a plate is collected, all plates at a distance of d units or less along its same column or row are attracted and collected instantly.

Note that this is a chain property. If plate a is attracted to plate b and plate c is attracted to plate a, then all three plates are collected at the same time.

Assuming any 1 plate can be chosen and collected in a second, calculate the minimum time required to collect the plates.

Input Format

The function getMinTime accepts the following parameters:

  • INTEGER n: the number of plates
  • INTEGER d: the magnetic power of the plates
  • INTEGER_ARRAY x: the x-coordinates of the plates
  • INTEGER_ARRAY y: the y-coordinates of the plates

Output Format

Return an INTEGER: the minimum time required to collect all the plates.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ n ≤ 105
  • 0 ≤ d ≤ 109
  • 0 ≤ X[i] ≤ 109
  • 0 ≤ Y[i] ≤ 109

Examples

Input:
n = 4, d = 1
x = [0, 0, 1, 2]
y = [0, 1, 0, 2]
Output:
2
Plates 1, 2, and 3 are within d = 1 unit distance of each other, so they are collected in 1 second. Plate 4 is collected in another second for a total of 2 seconds. 
Input:
n = 3, d = 0
x = [0, 0, 1]
y = [0, 1, 2]
Output:
3
Since d = 0, no plates are collected together, so each plate takes 1 second to collect. 
Input:
n = 4, d = 5
x = [0, 0, 1, 1]
y = [2, 5, 5, 1]
Output:
1
All plates are within a distance of 5 units and are collected in a single second.
